intro: Thamnochortus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid tussock grass, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are rigid and grass-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Thamnochortus rigidus is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
